title: Everything You Need to Know About Presidents’ Day 2025 — Plus, Deals You Can Shop Right Now!
description: Get your Presidents' Day shopping plan in place! READ MORE...
author: Haley Lyndes
excerpt: Get your Presidents' Day shopping plan in place!
text: Kitchen & HomeSales & DealsHaley LyndesCommerce SEO WriterI'm the SEO writer for both Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. I'm passionate about interior design, decor hacks, finding comfortable bedding (since she sleeps hot), and starting my day with a warm cup of coffee. My work has been featured in BuzzFeed, PopSugar, Travel + Leisure, and other publications. published nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Hey, we did it — we survived what felt like all 300 days of January! If you were too busy to shop, don’t worry. A lovely, long three-day weekend and its sales are right around the corner. Presidents’ Day is the perfect time to score deals on everything from  big-ticket home items to that Dutch oven you’ve been eyeing. So, when is the Presidents’ Day weekend, when do the sales start, and what kinds of deals can you expect? We’ve got all the answers below. When Is Presidents’ Day 2025?Presidents’ Day falls on Monday, February 17, this year. It’s the perfect time to shop, with tons of great deals up for grabs all weekend long!When Do Presidents’ Day Sales Start?Like most big sales, Presidents’ Day deals kick off well before the actual holiday. Even though the holiday is a few weeks away, the sales are already rolling in — and they’re not slowing down anytime soon. The best deals, though, will hit during the long weekend (February 15-17) with extra special offers from your favorite retailers.What to Buy During Presidents’ Day 2025With Presidents’ Day being one of the biggest sale events to kick off 2025, it’s important to be strategic about what you’re looking for. Maybe you’re still in need of a last-minute Valentine’s Day gift, or perhaps you’re shopping for bigger-ticket items like a mattress that won’t cause back pain or a new pillow that actually offers support. One thing we like to remind people to look out for is seasonal items, like outdoor furniture. While it might seem early, you can score fantastic deals and be ready for spring whenever it arrives! The Best Early Presidents’ Day SalesReady to start shopping? Below, we’ve rounded up some of the best early Presidents’ Day deals, featuring a mix of our favorite finds, editor-tested products, and a few new items we’ve got our eye on. 1 / 13Plank+Beam$339.00was $479.002 / 13Le Creuset$299.99was $475.00One of the best things about Le Creuset’s Dutch ovens is how easily they go from the oven to the table, making them perfect for cooking and serving. The oval shape is a nice twist on the classic round pot, though honestly, you can’t go wrong with either.3 / 13Amazon$169.00was $249.00Apple devotees agree that AirPods Pro is worth the splurge, thanks to upgraded features like active noise cancellation, touch sensors, and sure-fit silicone tips. And at 32% off, this is an early deal worth taking advantage of.4 / 13QVC.com$69.98was $77.00Treat your Valentine (or yourself!) to a special dinner with these Kansas City Steak Co. Tenderloin Medallions. These 2-ounce steaks are perfect for an elegant, intimate meal, delivering a melt-in-your-mouth experience. They’re individually packaged for convenience and can be prepared to perfection in minutes!5 / 13Saatva$1799.00was $2099.00Innerspring mattresses may seem old-school, but Mark, our director of commerce, swears by this one for his back pain. The top layer is firm yet “plush, cushy, and breathable,” Mark says. “It kept me comfortable throughout the brutally hot summer months, whether sleeping on my side, back, or stomach.” If you’re a hot sleeper who experiences back pain, this mattress is for you!6 / 13Momofuku$70.00was $78.00Try every flavor of Momofuku's restaurant-quality noodles with this sampler pack, featuring spicy, savory, and tangy broths with springy wheat noodles. See what our five ramen-loving editors have to say about the variety pack, which they ranked.7 / 13Amazon$89.99was $119.99Cosori is one of the most popular air fryer makers out there — and we’re big fans. This large 6-quart air fryer includes nine easy functions for making anything from steak to fries. While surprisingly compact, it can easily feed up to four people, making it perfect for families.8 / 13All-Clad$149.99was $200.00Though we haven’t tried out this exact model, our contributor Stella tried out the D3 line’s sauté pan, which has become the most-used item in her kitchen. We’re sure the fry pan also has a “surface that heats evenly and steadily and is never a pain to clean.”9 / 13Amazon$59.99was $79.99Say goodbye to cabinet clutter with the Seinlous Expandable Pull-Out Cabinet Organizer. It slides out easily, making it superconvenient for storing your pots, pans, and other kitchen essentials. Plus, it’s expandable, so it fits most cabinet sizes!10 / 13Amazon$187.00was $229.99You’ll never have to go to the store for ice cream again — or for sorbet, gelato, slushies, milkshakes, and smoothie bowls — once you pick up the ever-popular Ninja CREAMi. “It’s so easy to store premade mixtures in the freezer that I often have multiple pints frozen at one time,” Best List editor Britt wrote about the original version. “Whenever I have a craving for something sweet, all I have to do is grab one, load it into the Ninja CREAMi, and enjoy it — all in less than five minutes.”11 / 13Big Spoon Roasters$17.99Make every snack a little better with Linzer Cookie Cashew & Almond Butter. With bright notes of lemon and raspberry, this spread is as delicious as it is unique — and it’s available for a limited time! “You can spread it on toast or top your oatmeal, but I love using it to elevate my bakes,” says Commerce Editor Micki, who added it to her scones. Use our exclusive code, Kitchn10, for 10% off at checkout!12 / 13KitchenAid$69.99was $99.99Whip up your favorite recipes with the KitchenAid 5-Quart Meringue Ceramic Bowl! Whether you’re using it with your stand mixer for ease or mixing by hand, this bowl has got you covered. Its sleek, meringue color adds a pop of style to your kitchen, and its sturdy ceramic design gives you the support you need.13 / 13West Elm$34.99was $56.00The Juliana Glassware Sets are perfect for adding a little elegance to any occasion! Whether you're sipping wine, cocktails, or just water, these glasses make it feel special. They're stylish, durable, and simple enough for everyday use, so you can enjoy them every day or save them for something a bit fancier.My Kitchn HelperGet our favorite editor-tested and -approved finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Kitchen & Home
  • Sales & Deals

Haley LyndesCommerce SEO Writer

I'm the SEO writer for both Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. I'm passionate about interior design, decor hacks, finding comfortable bedding (since she sleeps hot), and starting my day with a warm cup of coffee. My work has been featured in BuzzFeed, PopSugar, Travel + Leisure, and other publications.

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Hey, we did it — we survived what felt like all 300 days of January! If you were too busy to shop, don’t worry. A lovely, long three-day weekend and its sales are right around the corner. Presidents’ Day is the perfect time to score deals on everything from  big-ticket home items to that Dutch oven you’ve been eyeing. So, when is the Presidents’ Day weekend, when do the sales start, and what kinds of deals can you expect? We’ve got all the answers below. 

When Is Presidents’ Day 2025?

Presidents’ Day falls on Monday, February 17, this year. It’s the perfect time to shop, with tons of great deals up for grabs all weekend long!

When Do Presidents’ Day Sales Start?

Like most big sales, Presidents’ Day deals kick off well before the actual holiday. Even though the holiday is a few weeks away, the sales are already rolling in — and they’re not slowing down anytime soon. The best deals, though, will hit during the long weekend (February 15-17) with extra special offers from your favorite retailers.

What to Buy During Presidents’ Day 2025

With Presidents’ Day being one of the biggest sale events to kick off 2025, it’s important to be strategic about what you’re looking for. Maybe you’re still in need of a last-minute Valentine’s Day gift, or perhaps you’re shopping for bigger-ticket items like a mattress that won’t cause back pain or a new pillow that actually offers support. One thing we like to remind people to look out for is seasonal items, like outdoor furniture. While it might seem early, you can score fantastic deals and be ready for spring whenever it arrives! 

The Best Early Presidents’ Day Sales

Ready to start shopping? Below, we’ve rounded up some of the best early Presidents’ Day deals, featuring a mix of our favorite finds, editor-tested products, and a few new items we’ve got our eye on. 

1 / 13

Plank+Beam

$339.00

was $479.00

2 / 13

Le Creuset

$299.99

was $475.00

One of the best things about Le Creuset’s Dutch ovens is how easily they go from the oven to the table, making them perfect for cooking and serving. The oval shape is a nice twist on the classic round pot, though honestly, you can’t go wrong with either.

3 / 13

Amazon

$169.00

was $249.00

Apple devotees agree that AirPods Pro is worth the splurge, thanks to upgraded features like active noise cancellation, touch sensors, and sure-fit silicone tips. And at 32% off, this is an early deal worth taking advantage of.

4 / 13

QVC.com

$69.98

was $77.00

Treat your Valentine (or yourself!) to a special dinner with these Kansas City Steak Co. Tenderloin Medallions. These 2-ounce steaks are perfect for an elegant, intimate meal, delivering a melt-in-your-mouth experience. They’re individually packaged for convenience and can be prepared to perfection in minutes!

5 / 13

Saatva

$1799.00

was $2099.00

Innerspring mattresses may seem old-school, but Mark, our director of commerce, swears by this one for his back pain. The top layer is firm yet “plush, cushy, and breathable,” Mark says. “It kept me comfortable throughout the brutally hot summer months, whether sleeping on my side, back, or stomach.” If you’re a hot sleeper who experiences back pain, this mattress is for you!

6 / 13

Momofuku

$70.00

was $78.00

Try every flavor of Momofuku's restaurant-quality noodles with this sampler pack, featuring spicy, savory, and tangy broths with springy wheat noodles. See what our five ramen-loving editors have to say about the variety pack, which they ranked.

7 / 13

Amazon

$89.99

was $119.99

Cosori is one of the most popular air fryer makers out there — and we’re big fans. This large 6-quart air fryer includes nine easy functions for making anything from steak to fries. While surprisingly compact, it can easily feed up to four people, making it perfect for families.

8 / 13

All-Clad

$149.99

was $200.00

Though we haven’t tried out this exact model, our contributor Stella tried out the D3 line’s sauté pan, which has become the most-used item in her kitchen. We’re sure the fry pan also has a “surface that heats evenly and steadily and is never a pain to clean.”

9 / 13

Amazon

$59.99

was $79.99

Say goodbye to cabinet clutter with the Seinlous Expandable Pull-Out Cabinet Organizer. It slides out easily, making it superconvenient for storing your pots, pans, and other kitchen essentials. Plus, it’s expandable, so it fits most cabinet sizes!

10 / 13

Amazon

$187.00

was $229.99

You’ll never have to go to the store for ice cream again — or for sorbet, gelato, slushies, milkshakes, and smoothie bowls — once you pick up the ever-popular Ninja CREAMi. “It’s so easy to store premade mixtures in the freezer that I often have multiple pints frozen at one time,” Best List editor Britt wrote about the original version. “Whenever I have a craving for something sweet, all I have to do is grab one, load it into the Ninja CREAMi, and enjoy it — all in less than five minutes.”

11 / 13

Big Spoon Roasters

$17.99

Make every snack a little better with Linzer Cookie Cashew & Almond Butter. With bright notes of lemon and raspberry, this spread is as delicious as it is unique — and it’s available for a limited time! “You can spread it on toast or top your oatmeal, but I love using it to elevate my bakes,” says Commerce Editor Micki, who added it to her scones. Use our exclusive code, Kitchn10, for 10% off at checkout!

12 / 13

KitchenAid

$69.99

was $99.99

Whip up your favorite recipes with the KitchenAid 5-Quart Meringue Ceramic Bowl! Whether you’re using it with your stand mixer for ease or mixing by hand, this bowl has got you covered. Its sleek, meringue color adds a pop of style to your kitchen, and its sturdy ceramic design gives you the support you need.

13 / 13

West Elm

$34.99

was $56.00

The Juliana Glassware Sets are perfect for adding a little elegance to any occasion! Whether you're sipping wine, cocktails, or just water, these glasses make it feel special. They're stylish, durable, and simple enough for everyday use, so you can enjoy them every day or save them for something a bit fancier.
